intro: Satureja dalmatica, commonly known as Dalmatian thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. The essential oils extracted from its leaves contain compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
